{"step_by_step_thinking": "Spondylolisthesis is a condition where one vertebra slips forward over the one below it. It is most commonly diagnosed using imaging techniques. CT and MR are both very useful in diagnosing this condition as they provide detailed images of the spine. X-ray lumbar spine- AP view and X-ray lumbar spine- Lateral view are also used, but they provide less detailed images compared to CT and MR.
